section.title: Description
section.para: The component adds an action listener to a parent component to provide possibility of Ajax update. It works like the <f:actionListener> or <f:valueChangeListener> JSF components but for the whole Ajax container.

listitem.para: The listener is invoked for Ajax requests only
The listener is always guaranteed to be invoked

section.title: Details of Usage
section.para:
The <a4j:ajaxListener> component adds an action listener to a parent component, which needs to be provided with Ajax support. That listener is invoked on each Ajax request during the "Render Response" JSF phase. In comparison with JSF <f:actionListener> and <f:valueChangeListener>
the invocation of the <a4j:ajaxListener> is not skipped in case when validation of Update Model fails. The <a4j:ajaxListener> is guarantied to be invoked for each Ajax response.

note.para: Ajax listener is not invoked for non-Ajax requests and when RichFaces works in the "Ajax Request generates Non-Ajax Response" mode.

section.para: As example of the <a4j:ajaxListener> component usage one can cite an updating the list of re-rendered components.

The "type" attribute defines the fully qualified Java class name for the listener. This Java class implements
org.ajax4jsf.event.AjaxListener
interface, which is base interface for all listeners, capable for receiving Ajax events. The source of the event could be accessed using the
java.util.EventObject.getSource()
call.
section.programlisting: ... <a4j:commandLink id="cLink" value="Click it To Send Ajax Request"> <a4j:ajaxListener type="demo.Bean"/> </a4j:commandLink> ...
